thread.title: AFL Grand Final Melbourne: What to do
thread.title_full: AFL Grand Final Melbourne: What to do | DailyTelegraph

author: Rowena Ryan
title: AFL Grand Final Melbourne: What to do
text:
THERE’S one city in Australia who is going to be so hot this weekend and we’re not just talking about the weather. The AFL Grand Final in Melbourne is one of the biggest sporting days of the year. Here are the seven hottest reasons you’ll want to be there.
1. The weather
For the first time since March, Melbourne will experience temperatures over 30 degrees Celsius. This Saturday is forecast to be 31 degrees, Sunday 30 degrees and Monday 32 degrees. Which means instead of rain at the MCG, fans will have the unusual concern of trying not to get burnt.
Last year’s AFL Grand Final Parade with Hawks players. Picture: Wayne Ludbey
Former Geelong footballer Steve Johnson in the Toyota classic catch foam pit ahead of the AFL Grand Final festival. Picture: Jason Edwards
The famous MCG will roar to life on Saturday. Pictures: Tim Carrafa
Canadian Bryan Adams is set to light up the stage.
The MCG is having an open to the public day the day after the 2015 AFL Grand Final. Picture: Mark Stewart
